title: Never Say Goodbye (musical)
text:
Never Say Goodbye is a <a href="musical%20theatre">musical</a> with a book and lyrics by Shûichirô Koike and music by <a href="Frank%20Wildhorn">Frank Wildhorn</a>. It was written specifically for <a href="Takarazuka%20Revue">Takarazuka Revue</a>, the all-female <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese theatre company. Wildhorn was the first non-Japanese to write an original musical for the company.
Set against the background of the <a href="Spanish%20Civil%20War">Spanish Civil War</a>, the plot centers on <a href="socialism">socialist</a> <a href="playwright">playwright</a> Katherine McGregor and renowned photographer Georges Malraux, a <a href="Poland">Polish</a> <a href="Jew">Jew</a> who fled his homeland for <a href="Paris">Paris</a>. The two first meet in Hollywood at a party announcing the film adaptation of Katherine's play "Tempest in Spain", based on the <a href="opera">opera</a> "<a href="Carmen">Carmen</a>". The two are reunited in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, where they unexpectedly find themselves falling in love as they become embroiled in a battle against <a href="fascism">fascism</a>.
Directed by Koike, the production was staged in 2006 at the <a href="Takarazuka%20Grand%20Theater">Takarazuka Grand Theater</a> in <a href="Takarazuka%2C%20Hy%C5%8Dgo">Takarazuka, Hyōgo</a> from March 24 through May 8, and at the <a href="Tokyo%20Takarazuka%20Theater">Tokyo Takarazuka Theater</a> in <a href="Tokyo%2C%20Japan">Tokyo, Japan</a> from May 26 through July 2. The cast included <a href="Mari%20Hanafusa">Mari Hanafusa</a> as Katherine and <a href="Y%C5%8Dka%20Wao">Yōka Wao</a> as Georges. "Never Say Goodbye" marked the final performance of both stars before their retirement from the troupe.
A full-length cast recording, a folio of sheet music, and a video and DVD of the show have been released.
